tv.generator-info-name: Processed by Open-EPG Visual Processor v1.0

programme.title: rage FIFTY 2025: Best Of The Rest Special
programme.desc: Everyones a winner on rage with the best videos that didnt quite crack the 2025 rage FIFTY.

programme.title: Weekend Breakfast
programme.desc: Ease into your Sunday as Fauziah Ibrahim and Johanna Nicholson present a mix of the latest news, updated information, analysis, interviews, politics, global affairs, culture and weather. Plus sport with Daniela Intili.

programme.title: Eat The Invaders
programme.desc: Tony Armstrong explores the European Carps culinary potential and ecological impact in Australia, challenging perceptions while transforming this invasive fish into a sustainable food source.

programme.title: Compass
programme.desc: Follow Sydneys Yes In My Backyard movement on their quest to change attitudes on housing. With Sydney on track to become a city with no grandchildren, YIMBYs are fighting for the right to shelter and the future of their city.

programme.title: Gardening Australia
programme.sub-title: Green Waste, Native Flowers and Garden Design
programme.desc: Millie Ross visits a cut-flower wonderland, Jane Edmanson learns how market waste makes garden goodies, Josh Byrne has tips for year-round greens, and garden designer Fiona Brockhoff shares plants and places that inspire her.

programme.title: Long Lost Family
programme.desc: Follow the stories of Louise Stoppani, who seeks the father that she never knew, and Jonathan Gaskarth, who seeks to understand his birth parents experience.

programme.title: Grand Designs Australia
programme.desc: Rita and James have just 230 thousand dollars to self-build a sustainable, off-grid family home for themselves and their two kids. They plan to use recycled plastic bags, milk cartons, home-made bricks, and an earthen floor.

programme.title: Nigellas Christmas Table
programme.desc: Nigella decamps to the countryside against a backdrop of crackling log fires and sparkling lights. Nigella shares her tips for relaxed entertaining, bringing new and festive flavours to familiar and traditional fare.

programme.title: The Art Of...
programme.desc: On a journey to discover what happened to her inner child, Namila Benson seeks advice from beloved painter Ken Done, award winning ceramicist Glenn Barkley and mischievous puppeteers The Snuff Puppets.

programme.title: Take 5 With Zan Rowe
programme.desc: Music runs in Jarvis Cockers veins. From manifesting his band Pulp as a teenager in Sheffield, to making a career as one of the defining acts of the Britpop era, his songs are his story.

programme.title: Death In Paradise
programme.desc: The team investigate the mysterious death of an astronomer after he falls from a cliff during a rare planetary event. Meanwhile, is romance blossoming for Neville?

programme.title: Good Game Spawn Point
programme.sub-title: Samba De Amigo and Noob Cops Part 2
programme.desc: This week on GGSP, we get our groove on and shake our maracas in Samba De Amigo: Party Central, plus the Noob Cops continue their thrilling investigation into a suspicious wave of Noob crimes.

programme.title: The Inbestigators
programme.sub-title: The Case Of The Triple Inbestigation
programme.desc: While on the hunt for Ezras missing goldfish, Maudie uncovers two more puzzling mysteries to be solved.

programme.title: Scooby-Doo And Guess Who?
programme.sub-title: What A Night, For A Dark Knight!
programme.desc: In Gotham City, Batman refuses the help of Mystery, Inc.

programme.title: The Powerpuff Girls
programme.desc: Bubbles bad school photo sends her into a funk.

programme.title: Miraculous: Tales Of Ladybug And Cat Noir
programme.desc: Ladybug faces her own father, akumatized into Weredad. The monstrous guard dog-man wants to lock Marinette up to protect her from the outside world!

programme.title: The Next Step
programme.desc: Pascale and Heath try to repair their relationship until the arrival of Daisy throws a wrench in their plans. Ariana and Michelle team up to get A-Troupe back to Regionals.

programme.title: Malory Towers
programme.desc: Its about to kick off! In a bid to prove that girls are just as good at football as boys, Felicity and June disguise Clarissa to look like her brother. Plus, Darrell and Susan help Mr Murray with his chamber investigation.

programme.title: Be Cool, Scooby-Doo!
programme.desc: Daphne brings the gang to a Victorian murder mystery party, so they can dress up and solve a fake mystery for once.

programme.title: Shaun The Sheep
programme.desc: Bitzer discovers Shaun watching old home movies in the barn. However, they dont like everything they see! Things get heated as the pair try to outdo each other by showing embarrassing clips from each others past.

programme.title: Operation Ouch!
programme.desc: The Doctors crush a car to reveal the secret of the special fluid which enables your joints to withstand huge amounts of force, and they find out what its like to be aeroplane Cabin Crew in Operation Takeover.

programme.title: Operation Ouch!: Do Try This At Home
programme.desc: Dr Chris and Dr Xand look at water in your body and show how to make an egg fountain in todays DO try this at home experiment.

programme.title: rage Beyond the Band Special
programme.desc: rage lines up clips from artists who left their bands behind and became even bigger solo. Featuring Gwen Stefani, Peter Gabriel, Beyonce, Harry Styles and more.

programme.title: Ghosts
programme.desc: Mike and Alison receive a life-changing offer far beyond their expectations.

programme.title: Total Dramarama
programme.sub-title: The Three Stooges Save Christmas Pt. 1
programme.desc: The kids accidentally destroy Chefs decorated Christmas tree. Scared this means theyve ruined his Christmas, they go on an epic mission to replace his holiday treasures.

programme.title: Teen Titans Go!
programme.desc: Santa Claus and Robin must stop the nefarious Coal Miner.

programme.title: Moominvalley
programme.desc: When Moominpappa and Moomintrolls story battle gets out of hand, a monstrous fish comes to life and Moominhouse is overrun by a wild jungle. Can the storytellers work together to find a happy ending?

programme.title: Star Wars: Young Jedi Adventures
programme.desc: The Jedi help two bounty hunters work together.

programme.title: Do Not Watch This Show
programme.desc: A witchs spell is going to transform Wizz into a frog if you watch this episode! Can he trick you into switching off?

programme.title: Mythbusters
programme.desc: 22,000 Feet Fall explores the incredible and seemingly impossible myth of a WWII, turret gunner falling 22,000 feet only to be saved by the explosion of a thousand pound bomb beneath him!

programme.title: Phil Spencer: Secret Agent
programme.desc: Mother and son Barbara and Paul Bainbridge have been trying to shift their four-bed in Newcastle for seven months. The pair love their motorbikes but, as Phil discovers, the house is totally lacking any va-va-vrooom.

programme.title: Louis Therouxs Altered States: Take My Baby
programme.desc: California is the US adoption capital, with 85% of newborn adoptions carried out privately, rather than arranged by the state. Louis Theroux talks to women choosing to hand over their own flesh and blood in open adoptions.

programme.title: Rage New Music
programme.desc: Discover the wildest new music videos on rage. Essential grooves and boundary-pushing visuals from Australia and beyond.

programme.title: Adam Hills: The Last Leg
programme.sub-title: Harry Hill, Chris Packham And Jordan Gray
programme.desc: Adam Hills, Josh Widdicombe and Alex Brooker are joined by special guests Harry Hill, Chris Packham and Jordan Gray for an entertaining, off-beat look at the big events of the past week.

programme.title: Total Dramarama
programme.desc: Duncan tricks Chef into taking the class to the North Pole in order to remove his name from the naughty list.

programme.title: Miraculous: Tales Of Ladybug And Cat Noir
programme.desc: While Marinette waits for Adrien at the zoo, the zookeeper gets akumatized into Animan, a shapeshifter who can take the form of any animal.

programme.title: Moominvalley
programme.desc: Moomintrolls mind starts to play tricks on him when hes left home alone overnight for the first time. But his worst fears are realised with the appearance of an all-too-real, nightmarish creature - The Groke!

programme.title: Shaun The Sheep
programme.desc: The Farmer is attempting to learn how to ballroom dance using Pidsley as his dancing partner. The din they create annoys the sheep so much that Shaun decides he has to do something to stop them.

programme.title: Total Drama Island
programme.desc: Chef finally gets to show off his fancy culinary skills in an eating challenge where each dish is a tastebuds nightmare. The last camper still eating wins immunity. The rest are all up for elimination.

programme.title: We Baby Bears
programme.desc: Squatter Otter tries to win Pandas trust and convince the Bears to live in a mysterious house.

programme.title: Steven Universe
programme.desc: Steven shows the Gems his kind of adventure by taking them to the Fun Land Arcade, where Garnet becomes enchanted by a dancing game.

programme.title: Phil Spencer: Secret Agent
programme.desc: Jason and Maya Lawie have been trying to sell their home for seven months, and move from Niddrie in Edinburgh to Lancashire. Theyre a creative couple but this could be exactly what is putting buyers off their home.

programme.title: Penn And Teller: Fool Us
programme.desc: Featured magicians include Cash, Ales Hrdlicka, Henry and Klauss, and Jonah Babins and Ben Train.

programme.title: Spooks
programme.desc: When a highly skilled trio of Chinese agents arrive in London for 48 hours only, the team must find out why they are there.

programme.title: Star Wars: Young Jedi Adventures
programme.desc: The young Jedi help a bounty hunter find a lost pet.

programme.title: Ben And Hollys Little Kingdom
programme.desc: Holly is going on a camping trip with Ben and his mum and dad, but they are soon joined by annoying Mr Gnome, who is always hungry and sings silly songs.

programme.title: Twirlywoos
programme.desc: The Twirlywoos watch an artist make his clay sculptures head smaller. They have a go and make the whole sculpture smaller until it is smaller than the Twirlywoos themselves.

programme.title: Daniel Tigers Neighbourhood
programme.desc: Prince Wednesday needs to get dressed before he can go outside to see the butterflies and play with Chrissie.

programme.title: Peppa Pig
programme.desc: Peppa and George meet Kylie Kangaroo and her brother Joey. Peppa shows Kylie how to jump up and down in muddy puddles, but who can jump the highest?

programme.title: The Adventures Of Paddington
programme.desc: Paddington wishes to take a photo of a meteor shower and must use an antique camera loaned by Mr Gruber. Unfortunately, it only has three pictures left on it. Can Paddington get the shot?

programme.title: Isadora Moon
programme.desc: When Isadora prepares a special Witch event for Mirabelle, Oscar wants to join in too.

programme.title: Bluey
programme.desc: On Bingo and Blueys Rug Island, a pack of felt pens can be anything - bananas, campfires, even a snake! But Dad will need to embrace his inner kid if he wants to make it his home.

programme.title: Knee High Spies
programme.desc: The spies play a series of games against Silver Paw, trying to win back the dominoes shes stolen from the kids domino run.

programme.title: Fizzy And Suds
programme.desc: Fizzy and Suds explore a fire truck and station! They see gear, practice drills, and ride out on a rescue run. Firefighters carry lots of gear and do many jobs beyond fighting fires!

programme.title: Adventures Of Paddington: Lost Letter
programme.desc: Paddington has sent Jonathans Santa letter to Peru by mistake. He sends Pigeonton to The North Pole with a new list but now hes missing. A storm causes a power cut which means Christmas will be ruined for everyone.

programme.title: Maddie + Triggs
programme.desc: When a rogue fly buzzes in through Maddies bedroom window, Triggs and Dad attempt to find the most effective way of dealing with this uninvited, buzzy houseguest.

programme.title: Andy And The Band
programme.desc: Jackies horse wont jump. But Hugh isnt any old horse - hes a pantomime horse!

programme.title: Peppa Pig
programme.desc: Peppa and friends along with Mummy sheep and Granny Sheep are taking Vanessa to Grampy Rabbits boat yard to be inspired. The children make all sorts of creations from things lying around!

programme.title: Ginger And The Vegesaurs
programme.desc: Ginger and the baby Pea-Rexes inadvertently start a massive roar off with all the other Vegesaurs.

programme.title: Vida The Vet
programme.desc: Zigzag hurts her foot. Can she deliver her packagaes in time for Vidas surprise Vet Day party?

programme.title: Octonauts
programme.sub-title: The Octonauts And The Undersea Storm
programme.desc: When Kwaziis Gup-B breaks down in a storm, not even brave Captain Barnacles can save him alone. Fortunately, a chain of reef lobsters lends a hand - and some claws.

programme.title: PJ Masks
programme.sub-title: Heroes Of The Road Part I
programme.desc: The PJ Masks cant wait to use their PJ Vehicles against Carly and Cartoka. Part 1

programme.title: Fireman Sam
programme.desc: When Charlie and Bronwyn take the kids on a sailing lesson, Charlie feels upstaged by Peter and a seagull. As Charlie tries to win back the kids attention, he ends up sinking the boat.

programme.title: Kiri And Lou
programme.desc: Kiri and Lou gather Yum Yum Baronies on Nonsense Day.

programme.title: Millie Magnificent
programme.desc: Discovering the importance of bees, Millie and her friends build a bee hotel to welcome buzzy guests into the community garden.

programme.title: Gardening Australia Junior
programme.desc: Hannah and the junior gardeners make pots so magical; they disappear into the garden!

programme.title: Peppa Pig
programme.desc: Peppa, George, Molly Mole and Freddy Fox dig a huge tunnel and find a box of pirate treasure and the police seem to be missing their pirate treasure. Something mysterious is going on.

programme.title: Peter Rabbit
programme.sub-title: The Tale Of The Bird Trap
programme.desc: When Mr Tods efforts to creep up on the rabbits are thwarted by a noisy Song Thrush, he cages the bird so that he can ambush Peter and his friends without warning...

programme.title: PJ Masks
programme.desc: An Yu tries to domesticate the wild Wolfies, rather than working with their instincts.

programme.title: Hey Duggee
programme.desc: Duggee is sewing a snazzy poncho. The squirrels want to make one too. They all get down to some sewing.

programme.title: Piripenguins
programme.desc: Fed up with requests, Looph deliberately disappears forcing the Piris to turn detective.

programme.title: Star Wars: Young Jedi Adventures
programme.desc: The young Jedi investigate a haunted mine.

programme.title: Ben And Hollys Little Kingdom
programme.desc: Snooty King and Queen Marigold invite themselves round for dinner to King and Queen Thistles Castle to sample Nanny Plums cooking. Nanny, the best cook in the world, tries hard to cook special modern food.

programme.title: Twirlywoos
programme.desc: The fruit tea-loving bird-like characters watch a man polishing a suit of armour, but spot that he has dropped the cloth inside the armour.

programme.title: Daniel Tigers Neighbourhood
programme.desc: When Daniel and O are playing post office, their wagon breaks. They look around and find something else to use.

programme.title: Peppa Pig
programme.desc: Mummy Dog and Danny are very excited! Captain Daddy Dog is home from the sea, bearing gifts!

programme.title: The Adventures Of Paddington
programme.desc: Judy is looking after the school pet gerbil, which is accidentally released by Paddington. Paddington and Judy search the house and Mr Currys garden looking for it.

programme.title: Ben And Hollys Little Kingdom
programme.desc: Ben and Holly visit the bee hive to see how honey is made. Wise Old Elf is the bee keeper and he proceeds to show the children his special way of collecting honey...

programme.title: Peppa Pig
programme.desc: At Playgroup, Madame Gazelle talks to the children about hobbies. The children share what they and their parents like to do for fun but everyone knows Peppas hobby is jumping in muddy puddles!

programme.title: Kangaroo Beach
programme.desc: Its Carnival Day at Kangaroo Beach, with two teams competing in lifeguard games. But its the young cadets versus the lifeguards - how can they possibly win against a stellar team of grown-up champions?

programme.title: Big Lizard
programme.desc: Dad drops an essential gizmo in a hard-to-reach place. Big Lizard takes them on an underwater adventure to meet Ammon, the tentacled solution to their problem!

programme.title: Play School
programme.desc: Emma and Kaeng make a yummy carrot cake for Emmas birthday and have a surprise party with the toys! We see a family welcoming and celebrating a newborn baby and Through The Windows, we learn about Buddhas birthday.

programme.title: Mixmups
programme.desc: The MixMups start a game of building a bigger-than-me-cake. Will the Mixmups find "another way" for Spin to see through his plan to eat the entire cake all by himself?

programme.title: Bing
programme.desc: Bing is playing in the garden when he sees his shadow; Flop has one too. Flop and Bing play shadow tag, taking it in turns to be It, but a raincloud covers the sun and the shadows disappear.

programme.title: Bluey
programme.desc: At the end of a long day, Bluey and her family are out of sync and out of sorts, so Mum gets everyone to play musical statues.

programme.title: Mister Maker Around The World
programme.desc: Discover how to make a brilliant boat in Hong Kong, a flicky lion picture in South Africa and a paper bag house... in just one minute! And what does Mister Maker find floating through the air outside Buckingham Palace.

programme.title: Thomas And Friends: All Engines Go
programme.desc: When the engines take on an icky, stinky, muddy job, Kana is given the best job on a fast clean route, until she realises that she would rather use her skills to make a difference for her friends.

programme.title: Peppa Pig
programme.desc: Peppa, George, Molly Mole and Freddy Fox dig a huge tunnel and find a box of pirate treasure and the police seem to be missing their pirate treasure. Something mysterious is going on.

programme.title: Ginger And The Vegesaurs
programme.desc: Minty gets a birds-eye view of the Valley after being flung onto the back of a Baby BokChoydactyl.

programme.title: Tish Tash
programme.desc: Tish and Bobby are playing with building blocks in Bobbys bedroom but Rosa is displeased at the mess theyve made.

programme.title: Builder Brothers Dream Factory
programme.desc: Jonathan, Drew, Mel and Ayana have to find a clever way to unlock the Dream Factory after Biff accidentally locks himself in, and them out.

programme.title: Octonauts
programme.sub-title: The Octonauts And The Crab And Urchin
programme.desc: Barnacles and Kwazii investigate a disruption on a nearby reef: a Carrier Crab and the Urchin who lives on its shell just cant seem to get along.

programme.title: Hey Duggee
programme.desc: The Squirrels dont quite see the appeal of trees, but Duggee is only too happy to share his passion for these magnificent living things and teach the squirrels learn all about trees!

programme.title: Fireman Sam
programme.desc: A pesky mole causes trouble for Moose when the mole decides that Mooses Wild Man Golf course is the perfect place to build a few molehills.

programme.title: Play School: Make and Create
programme.desc: Abi and Takaya are in The Make and Create Studio using natural materials to decorate nature bags! Special guest Tegan weaves a basket for Jemima, and Abi and Takaya create bird costumes from materials found in The Useful Box!

programme.title: Peppa Pig
programme.desc: Peppa and her family visit a big shop full of little shops! Mummy is visiting the spa for a Perfect Day Experience, so Peppa, George and Daddy Pig explore the shopping centre in search of their own perfect days!

programme.title: Big Lizard
programme.desc: Dad has left Cosima in charge for the day. It seems like an excellent opportunity to have a massive party! What could possibly go wrong?

programme.title: Kangaroo Beach
programme.desc: Really Real Rescues visits Kangaroo Beach to film a TV special about the cadets, but trying to look cool on camera lands them in hot water.

programme.title: PJ Masks
programme.desc: Armadylan and CB compete over an exclusive Master Fang comic thinking it contains a hero secret.

programme.title: Hey Duggee
programme.desc: Duggee and the squirrels have bought Hennie a present for her birthday, but first they need to wrap it up. Its very big and will need rather a lot of paper. The Squirrels each choose some colourful paper and get wrapping.

programme.title: Supertato
programme.desc: Supertato and Broccoli are investigating a trail of shiny things when they meet Captain Pak Choi, theyre her shiny things and have been falling out of a hole in her ship.

programme.title: rage FIFTY 2025: Best Of The Rest Special
programme.desc: Everyones a winner on rage with the best videos that didnt quite crack the 2025 rage FIFTY.

programme.desc: Ease into your Sunday as Fauziah Ibrahim and Johanna Nicholson present a mix of the latest news, updated information, analysis, interviews, politics, global affairs, culture and weather. Plus sport with Daniela Intili.

programme.desc: Tony Armstrong explores the European Carps culinary potential and ecological impact in Australia, challenging perceptions while transforming this invasive fish into a sustainable food source.

programme.desc: Follow Sydneys Yes In My Backyard movement on their quest to change attitudes on housing. With Sydney on track to become a city with no grandchildren, YIMBYs are fighting for the right to shelter and the future of their city.

programme.sub-title: Green Waste, Native Flowers and Garden Design
programme.desc: Millie Ross visits a cut-flower wonderland, Jane Edmanson learns how market waste makes garden goodies, Josh Byrne has tips for year-round greens, and garden designer Fiona Brockhoff shares plants and places that inspire her.

programme.title: Long Lost Family
programme.desc: Follow the stories of Louise Stoppani, who seeks the father that she never knew, and Jonathan Gaskarth, who seeks to understand his birth parents experience.

programme.desc: Rita and James have just 230 thousand dollars to self-build a sustainable, off-grid family home for themselves and their two kids. They plan to use recycled plastic bags, milk cartons, home-made bricks, and an earthen floor.

programme.title: Nigellas Christmas Table
programme.desc: Nigella decamps to the countryside against a backdrop of crackling log fires and sparkling lights. Nigella shares her tips for relaxed entertaining, bringing new and festive flavours to familiar and traditional fare.

programme.title: The Art Of...
programme.desc: On a journey to discover what happened to her inner child, Namila Benson seeks advice from beloved painter Ken Done, award winning ceramicist Glenn Barkley and mischievous puppeteers The Snuff Puppets.

programme.title: Take 5 With Zan Rowe
programme.desc: Music runs in Jarvis Cockers veins. From manifesting his band Pulp as a teenager in Sheffield, to making a career as one of the defining acts of the Britpop era, his songs are his story.

programme.title: Death In Paradise
programme.desc: The team investigate the mysterious death of an astronomer after he falls from a cliff during a rare planetary event. Meanwhile, is romance blossoming for Neville?

programme.title: ABC News Overnight
programme.desc: The final word on the days top stories, with the latest news and updated information from Australias most trusted source of independent news. Presented by Lorna Dunkley.

programme.title: Jim Maxwells Ashes Memories
programme.sub-title: 2006 - Shane Warne bowls Australia to series victory at the Adelaide Oval
programme.desc: The history of the Ashes is littered with moments that have defined and intensified the rivalry between the two nations. ABC Cricket Commentator Jim Maxwell joins Corbin Middlemas to reflect on his Top 6 Ashes Moments.

programme.title: Deep Time: Australias Epic History
programme.desc: Solua Middleton takes you on a journey through some of this countrys ancient and epic past, exploring Indigenous Australias deep history with stories passed down through countless generations.

programme.title: Asia News Week
programme.desc: From hanging out backstage with Filipino TikTok star Nurse John, to the history of Indonesias golden era of horror, catch up on some of the best stories from Asia News Week in 2025 with host Yvonne Yong. (Final for 2025)

programme.title: BTN High
programme.desc: Cale visits a simulated space mission to the moon thats putting so-called analogue astronauts to the test.

programme.title: DW News
programme.desc: The latest international news and the days top stories from a European perspective. Our broadcast partner DW brings you live coverage from Berlin with updated reports and expert analysis on the big global issues and events.

programme.title: National Press Club Address
programme.sub-title: Ben Shewry - Chef, Restaurateur and Writer
programme.desc: Ben Shewry, chef, restaurateur, writer and creative leader, addresses the National Press Club of Australia on the topic "If you want to live a creative life". (Final for 2025)

programme.title: ABC News Update
programme.desc: Start your morning with the latest headlines from ABC News, updating you on the days top stories and the overnight news from across Australia and around the world.

programme.title: ABC News Regional
programme.desc: The man who murdered Toyah Cordingley in North Queensland sentenced to life in prison, the heart-stopping moment a skydivers parachute catches on a plane, plus we visit Australias biggest miniature railway. (Final for 2025)

programme.title: Jim Maxwells Ashes Memories
programme.desc: The voice of summer, ABC cricket commentator Jim Maxwell reflects on his six favourite Ashes moments, starting with the incident between Jonny Bairstow and Alex Carey at Lords in 2023 when Bairstow was stumped.

programme.title: ABC News At Noon
programme.desc: Melissa Mackay presents the latest from ABC News on the weekend bringing you todays top stories and coverage of events as they unfold. Plus original reporting, analysis and updated news, sport, weather and information.

programme.title: ABC News
programme.desc: Melissa Mackay presents the latest from ABC News on the weekend bringing you todays top stories and coverage of events as they unfold. Plus original reporting, analysis and updated news, sport, weather and information.

programme.desc: Melissa Mackay presents the latest from ABC News on the weekend bringing you todays top stories and coverage of events as they unfold. Plus original reporting, analysis and updated news, sport, weather and information.

programme.title: ABC News
programme.desc: Melissa Mackay presents the latest from ABC News on the weekend bringing you todays top stories and coverage of events as they unfold. Plus original reporting, analysis and updated news, sport, weather and information.

programme.title: ABC News
programme.desc: Melissa Mackay presents the latest from ABC News on the weekend bringing you todays top stories and coverage of events as they unfold. Plus original reporting, analysis and updated news, sport, weather and information.

programme.title: ABC News With Auslan
programme.desc: Melissa Mackay presents the latest news and information from ABC News. This bulletin will be Auslan interpreted to provide accessible information to keep Australias deaf community connected and informed. (Final for 2025)

programme.title: ABC Evening News
programme.desc: For the latest news as it happens ABC News is the home of breaking news, compelling stories and Australias best investigative journalism. Round the clock coverage of the news that matters to you from the team you can trust.

programme.title: ABC National News
programme.desc: Theres never been a more important time for transparency and trust. ABC News brings you the days top stories and latest news with more reporters to tell you whats going on and why it matters. Presented by Isabella Higgins.

programme.title: ABC News Tonight
programme.desc: Isabella Higgins brings you the latest headlines and a brief summary of the days top stories from ABC News.

programme.title: ABC Nightly News
programme.desc: Theres never been a more important time for transparency and trust. ABC News brings you todays top stories and latest news, with more reporters to tell you whats going on and why it matters. Presented by Isabella Higgins.

programme.title: ABC Late News Weekend
programme.desc: When you need to know whats happening turn to ABC News for coverage you can trust. Isabella Higgins brings you the days news by reporters in more locations across Australia, connecting communities and telling your stories.

programme.title: ABC Late News
programme.desc: Isabella Higgins brings you the latest news and a roundup of the days top stories from across Australia and around the globe.

programme.title: Close Of Business
programme.desc: A look at whats on the cards for the economy in 2026. Will interest rates rise and which way will markets move? Plus a Victorian country town which formed a co-op to prevent the sale of a historic property. (Final)

programme.title: Boyer Lecture Series
programme.desc: Julia Baird is joined in conversation with all five 2025 Boyer lecturers, Justin Wolfers, John Anderson, Larissa Behrendt, Amelia Lester and James Curran to reflect on the theme Australia: A Radical Experiment in Democracy.

programme.title: Landline
programme.desc: We look back at more of the best Landline stories from 2025. The koala sanctuary helping nature and people heal; Farming pompano: a little-known native white fish; plus can wind farms and farming coexist in Western Australia?

programme.title: ABC News Overnight
programme.desc: The final word on the days top stories, with the latest news and updated information from Australias most trusted source of independent news. Presented by Isabella Higgins.

programme.title: DW News
programme.desc: The latest international news and the days top stories from a European perspective. Our broadcast partner DW brings you live coverage from Berlin with updated reports and expert analysis on the big global issues and events.

programme.title: DW Focus On Europe
programme.desc: A proposed 3.3km suspension bridge across the Strait of Messina could connect Sicily with mainland Italy. Meanwhile in the west of France, birds of prey are trained to make takeoff and landing safer at airports.

programme.title: BTN High
programme.desc: Reality TV thrives on conflict, but is that conflict real? We look at the tips and tricks producers use to make compelling TV, and explore the impacts it can have.

programme.title: DW News
programme.desc: The latest international news and the days top stories from a European perspective. Our broadcast partner DW brings you live coverage from Berlin with updated reports and expert analysis on the big global issues and events.

programme.title: ABC News Mornings
programme.desc: Stay in the know with whats happening this morning. ABC News brings you up-to-the-minute news to fuel your daily conversations so you can stay connected and follow the discussion across the day. Presented by Gemma Veness.

programme.title: ABC News Day
programme.desc: For the latest news as it happens ABC News is the home of breaking news, compelling stories and Australias best original reporting. Melissa Mackay brings you news, interviews and analysis on the issues that matter to you.

programme.title: ABC News Summer
programme.desc: Joe OBrien presents the latest from ABC News, following todays top stories and coverage of events as they unfold. Plus original reporting, analysis and updated news, sport and weather you need across the summer holidays.

Sarah Ferguson presents Australias premier daily current affairs program, delivering agenda-setting journalism and interviews that hold the powerful to account. Plus reporting from Michael Rowland, Jacob Greber and the team.

programme.title: Australian Story
programme.desc: Celeste Barber went from unemployed actor to social media sensation for her celebrity parodies. But behind the hilarity is a story of struggle and self-doubt.

programme.title: ABC Nightly News
programme.desc: The home of breaking news and in-depth coverage of the big stories from across Australia and around the globe. The ABCs network of reporters cover important stories and all the news you need. Presented by Yvonne Yong.

programme.title: ABC Late News
programme.desc: More news, more often. Wherever you are stay in touch with ABC News. Weve got more reporters in more places, connecting communities and covering the stories and issues that matter to you. Presented by Jade Barker.
